channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Public Health Experts Want the Olympics to Drop Its Oldest Sponsor
item.description: Scientists, activists, and ordinary petitioners want the Olympics to break with Coca-Cola, comparing it to the tobacco companies that long sponsored the Games. They aren’t holding their breath.

item.title: X is getting closer to launching its payment service
item.description:
X (formerly Twitter) appears to be making progress on its upcoming payments system, bringing it closer to Elon Musk’s vision of turning X into an “everything app.”   According to a recent finding by app researcher Nima Owji, the company is working on adding a “Payments” button to the navigation bar under the bookmarks tab. Owji, […]

item.title: Elon Musk’s X Sues Advertisers Over Alleged Boycott
item.description: The platform's antitrust suit claims an alleged conspiracy to withhold advertising dollars. Right-wing video site Rumble filed a similar suit today.

item.title: Dawn Aerospace’s rocket-propelled aircraft takes flight
item.description:
Dawn Aerospace’s rocket-powered aircraft soared to new heights in its latest test campaign, as the company looks to build what could be the highest-performance aircraft to take off from a runway. The series of three flights, which were completed in late July, saw the Mk-II Aurora vehicle achieve a maximum speed of Mach 0.92 and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A New Plan to Break the Cycle of Destructive Critical Infrastructure Hacks
item.description: As digital threats against US water, food, health care, and other vital sectors loom large, a new project called UnDisruptable27 aims to help fix cybersecurity weaknesses where other efforts have failed.

item.title: Made by Google 2024: Pixel 9, Gemini, a new foldable and other things to expect from the event
item.description:
Google unveiled the Nest Learning Thermostat 4 and Google TV Streamer. It's expected to announce four Pixel devices, including the Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: AI Is Heating the Olympic Pool
item.description: A data center in Paris has been hooked up to the energy system heating the Olympic pool. But critics say that projects recycling data centers’ excess heat are a distraction from the real environmental costs of AI.

item.title: Waymo expands robotaxi coverage in Los Angeles and San Francisco
item.description:
Waymo, the Alphabet-owned self-driving car company, is adding another 10 square miles to its robotaxi service area to include cities surrounding San Francisco.  The move, which adds Daly City, Broadmoor and Colma, pushes its total commercial service territory to about 55 square miles. Waymo said Tuesday it is also adding 16 square miles of new robotaxi […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google 4th-Gen Nest Learning Thermostat and Google TV Streamer: Specs, Features, Price, Release Date
item.description: Nest’s connected thermostat gets a redesign and some AI smarts, while the brand-new iteration of the Chromecast serves as a hub for your smart home.

item.title: Europe’s most valuable fintech, and which startups became unicorns this year
item.description:
Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech! This week, we’re looking at Revolut’s reported valuation hike, fintech unicorns, the Disrupt Fintech Stage, and more. To get a roundup of TechCrunch’s biggest and most important fintech stories delivered to your inbox every Tuesday at 8 a.m. PT, subscribe here.
